articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military said on Monday it was conducting extensive strikes against targets of the Iranian-backed Hezbollah movement in Lebanon, which come amid some of the heaviest cross-border exchanges of fire in nearly a year of conflict.
articles.title: Israeli military says it is striking Hezbollah targets in Lebanon

articles.author: Kanishka Singh, Costas Pitas
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said his country is "closer to the end of the war" with Russia, according to excerpts of an interview with ABC News released on Monday.
articles.title: Zelenskiy says Ukraine closer to end of war with Russia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The escalation between Israel and Lebanon's Hezbollah is almost a full-fledged war, the European Union's foreign policy chief said on Monday.
articles.title: Nearly a full-fledged war in Lebanon, EU's Borrell says

articles.author: Keith Coffman
articles.description: Rejecting an insanity defense, a Colorado jury on Monday convicted a man diagnosed with the severe mental disorder schizophrenia of first-degree murder in a 2021 mass shooting at a grocery store in the city of Boulder that killed 10 people including a police officer.
articles.title: Gunman who killed 10 at Colorado supermarket in 2021 convicted of murder

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A court in Russia's Kaliningrad region sentenced a U.S. citizen to six years in jail and fined him for 100,000 roubles ($1,078) for kidnapping his son, a regional court said on Telegram.
articles.title: Russia jails US citizen for six years on kidnapping charges, court says

articles.author: Farah Master
articles.description: China's move to raise retirement ages is a starting point to plug gaping pension deficits and bolster a shrinking workforce but more pain lies ahead as the economy slows, making further reforms urgent, say economists and demographers.
articles.title: China's retirement age reforms not enough to fix pension headache

articles.author: Devjyot Ghoshal, Ruma Paul
articles.description: Bangladesh's army chief vowed to back the country's interim government "come what may" to help it complete key reforms after the ouster of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, so that elections could be held within the next 18 months.
articles.title: Bangladesh army chief pledges support for Yunus' interim government 'come what may'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A detachment of warships of Russia's Pacific Fleet and the Chinese Navy entered the Sea of ​​Okhotsk in the western Pacific as part of joint navy exercises, Russia's Interfax agency reported on Tuesday, citing the Pacific Fleet's press service.
articles.title: Russia, China warships enter Sea of Okhotsk for drills, Interax reports

articles.author: Xinghui Kok
articles.description: Singapore's former Transport Minister S. Iswaran has pleaded guilty to receiving gifts while in office, local media reported, as proceedings began on Tuesday in a rare graft trial involving a state official in this Asian financial hub.
articles.title: Ex-minister Iswaran pleads guilty in graft case that has gripped Singapore

articles.author: John Irish
articles.description: Russia is trying to knock out Ukraine's energy infrastructure ahead of the winter to leave it dark and in the cold, the EU's foreign policy chief said on Monday, saying Kyiv's Western allies needed to step up in providing air defences for Ukraine.
articles.title: West must boost aid to stop Russia plunging Ukraine into the dark, Borrell says
